subject: Re: Prolegomena for a new QS font
msgSnippet: Thank you for contributing to the Quikscript community. Some initial thoughts - It might have been better to post this (a story that uses the proposed font) as
messageBody:
Thank you for contributing to the Quikscript community.

Some initial thoughts -

It might have been better to post this (a story that uses the proposed
font) as well as an alphabet table of some sort so that people did not
have to "hunt" for certain letters. For instance, I did not notice
letters #1 or #32 after a quick glance. Are they in the story?

It is a very interesting interpretation of the alphabet. I am sure
that it was a lot of work simply getting it to the stage that it
currently is in.

You mentioned that the font was 'based on' another font but did you
mean that literally (as in, "you literally used the letters to make
the font") or just it's style?

Your font, even in it's current form, has made me re-think my own
plans for creating future Quikscript fonts.

Thank you for contributing to the Quikscript community.

Some initial thoughts -

It might have been better to post this (a story that uses the proposed
font) as well as an alphabet table of some sort so that people did not
have to "hunt" for certain letters. For instance, I did not notice
letters #1 or #32 after a quick glance. Are they in the story?

It is a very interesting interpretation of the alphabet. I am sure
that it was a lot of work simply getting it to the stage that it
currently is in.

You mentioned that the font was 'based on' another font but did you
mean that literally (as in, "you literally used the letters to make
the font") or just it's style?

Your font, even in it's current form, has made me re-think my own
plans for creating future Quikscript fonts.
